text: Do you mean how you can implement the set values in your stylesheet?

hey <@U7SL518D6>, i ran this update in VS Code then checked my version and it’s still 2.1.0. come to think of it…i’m not sure my updates have _ever_ worked. any ideas as to what’s going on?

```%                                                                                                                                                               
user@users-MacBook-Pro HubSpot % npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest
npm WARN deprecated request-promise-native@1.0.9: request-promise-native has been deprecated because it extends the now deprecated request package, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>
npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>
npm WARN deprecated resolve-url@0.2.1: <https://github.com/lydell/resolve-url#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated urix@0.1.0: Please see <https://github.com/lydell/urix#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
/Users/user/.npm-global/bin/hs -> /Users/user/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hs
/Users/user/.npm-global/bin/hscms -> /Users/user/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hscms
+ @HubSpot/cms-cli@2.2.2
updated 1 package in 9.607s
user@users-MacBook-Pro HubSpot % hs --version
2.1.0
user@users-MacBook-Pro HubSpot % ```
it appears it did update but you must have a local copy of the CLI as well as the global one. So the local copy is taking precedence
try the same command without the `-g`
Thanks <@U38EZFVFE> thats what I was figuring
no dice. that added a package-lock.json file to my local directory, but i’m still showing version 2.1.0

```%                                                                                                                                                               
user@users-MacBook-Pro HubSpot % npm install @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest

Hello all! Quick question to make sure I'm not going crazy - but I can't figure out how a domain stylesheet keeps getting injected into my template. I have `enableDomainStylesheets` set to false and same for `enable_domain_stylesheets` to false in my `theme.json` but somehow a previous master CSS file (which I am sadly unable to remove as it was setup by another dev and is being used on other pages) is showing up in the source of my new template I'm creating. Any suggestions for a frustrated HubSpot newbie? Cheers in advance.
has anybody ever tried using webpack chunking in a HUB theme? any suggestions for how to handle the dynamic URLs on HUB?
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate/issues/14> looks like this is a known issue. shame
I recommend chiming in on that issue to voice support for it. You are also welcome to contribute. The boilerplate is open source.
